## Data cleaning
## Fishers - main occupation

```{r finnmark main occupation}
age_finnmark_prep <- age_finnmark %>% 
  rename(municip_name = ...1, 
         municip_numb = ...2,
         age = ...3,
        "2019" = "20191)") %>% 
  mutate(municip_name = zoo::na.locf(municip_name)) %>% # fills in municipality name in NA columns 
  mutate(municip_numb = zoo::na.locf(municip_numb)) %>% 
  filter(!str_detect(.$municip_name,
                    pattern = "^Total." ))%>%  #Remove rows that show total no of fishers
  gather(key = year, value= count, -municip_name, -municip_numb, -age) #reshape format of table

age_finnmark_prep[is.na(age_finnmark_prep)] <- 0 #replace NA values with zero. NA values are zero in all cases except where municipalities merged/changed                                                 #names, which will be fixed in the following

Hammerfest_old<-filter(age_finnmark_prep, municip_numb == "2001")
Soroysund<-filter(age_finnmark_prep, municip_numb == "2016")

Hammerfest_new<-filter(age_finnmark_prep, municip_numb == "2004") 

Hammerfest_df<-mutate(Hammerfest_new, count = Hammerfest_old$count+Hammerfest_new$count + Soroysund$count) #pooling merged municipalitiess

age_finnmark_final<-left_join(age_finnmark_prep, Hammerfest_df, by =c("municip_numb","age","year")) %>%
  mutate(main_occupation = ifelse(municip_numb == "2004", count.y, count.x)) %>%
  select(-c(count.x, count.y,municip_name.y))%>%
  rename(municip_name = municip_name.x)%>%
  filter(!municip_numb %in% c("2016", "2001", "2099"))%>% #remove Sørøysund 2016, Hammerfest 2001 and uoppgitt kommune 2099
  complete(nesting(municip_name, municip_numb,year), age, fill = list(main_occupation = 0))%>% # add rows for age not included
  mutate(county = "Finnmark")

head(age_finnmark_final)

```

````{r troms main occupation}
